risks: Timing coordination between CSS transitions and JavaScript animations
Potential impact on other fade-in animations if intersection observer logic is modified
Need to ensure fix works across different browsers and devices

detailed_analysis.root_cause: Progress bars start with undefined width, CSS transition is immediately active, and setTimeout creates timing mismatch causing backward animation from initial state to 0% then forward to target percentage
detailed_analysis.solution_approach: Set initial width to 0% before applying transition, remove setTimeout delay, and ensure proper state management
detailed_analysis.implementation_complexity: Low - requires minimal code changes to 2 functions and 1 CSS rule
detailed_analysis.testing_requirements: Visual testing of skills section animation, cross-browser compatibility check
alternative_solutions: Use CSS animations instead of transitions
Add loading states to prevent premature animation triggers

issue_title: Bug: Skills progress bars flicker and move backwards during animation
